sen.j: 離宮（りきゅう）とは、皇居や王宮とは別に設けられた宮殿のことである。
sen.e: Rikyu is an Imperial villa which is separate from the Imperial Palace or the Palace.
Rikyu is an Imperial villa which is separate from the Imperial Palace or Palace.
Rikyu is an Imperial villa which is separate from the Imperial Palace or Palace.

sen.j: 一般的には王族・皇族等が居住するために建設された宮殿とは別の敷地に建設される。
sen.e: Generally Rikyu is built in different land from the Imperial Palace of the Royal family and the Imperial family.
Generally Rikyu is built on different land from the Imperial Palace of the Royal family and the Imperial family.
Generally Rikyu is built on different land from the Imperial Palace of the Royal Family and the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 例えば皇太子などが成人・結婚し、天皇・皇帝と別に住居を構える場合などが当たる。
sen.e: The good example of this is after Crown Prince become adult and marry to the partner, he will have separate palace from Emperor and the Empress, in this case the palace will be called Rikyu.
A good example of this is after Crown Prince becomes an adult and is married, he will have separate palace from the Emperor and the Empress, in this case the palace will be called Rikyu.
A good example of this is after Crown Prince becomes an adult and is married, he will have separate palace from the Emperor and the Empress, in this case the palace will be called Rikyu.

sen.j: また、避暑・避寒、静養のために建てられるものもある。
sen.e: Some Rikyu are built as summer or winter holiday villa or the one to stay for recuperation.
Some Rikyu are built as a summer or winter holiday villa or as a place to stay for recuperation.
Some Rikyu are built as a summer or winter holiday villa or as a place to stay for recuperation.

sen.j: 日本では一定規模の建造物と敷地を有するものを離宮とし、小規模のものを御用邸と称している。
sen.e: In Japan the villa with a certain size of the land and the villa itself, is called Rikyu, and the ones with small size are called goyotei. (Imperial villa)
In Japan a villa with a certain size of land including the villa itself, is called Rikyu, and the one of smaller size are called goyotei (Imperial villa).
In Japan a villa with a certain size of land including the villa itself, is called Rikyu, and the one of smaller size are called goyotei (Imperial villa).

sen.j: また、明治以前には太上天皇や法皇の退位後の離宮として「後院」と呼ばれる離宮が築かれて専属の役人が置かれた。
sen.e: Before Meiji period, there was Rikyu built as the retired emperor and the cloistered emperor's villa after the retirement, which was called 'Goin', there were some exclusive officials to look after the place.

Before the Meiji period, there were Rikyu built as a villa for a retired emperor and cloistered emperor for after their retirement, which were called 'Goin,' and there were exclusive officials to look after these places.

Before the Meiji period, there were Rikyu built as a villa for a retired emperor and cloistered emperor for after their retirement, which were called 'Goin,' and there were exclusive officials to look after these places.

sen.j: なお、平安時代の天皇の追号には後院の名称に由来するものが多い。
sen.e: By the way there were many posthumous title for the emperors during Heian period which came from the name of the goin.
There were many posthumous titles for emperors during the Heian period which came from the name of the goin.
There were many posthumous titles for emperors during the Heian period which came from the name of the goin.
